Prop 54: This proposition, placed on the ballot by a petition, would amend the California Constitution to prohibit state and local governments from classifying any person by race, ethnicity, color, or national origin in areas of public education, contracting or employment.
 
 Fox News exit polling:
 
 Hispanics 
 Yes on Prop 54 - 25% 
 No on Prop 54 - 75%
 
 
 
 So Hispanics are voting to be discriminated against?

public education, contracting or employment

Hispanics are voting to be discriminated against?

 
 No, because it sounds as if the people who wrote that bill aren't as interested in ending discrimination as they are in ending affirmative action, and methods of measuring discrimination.
 
 
Those who oppose the measure say that a data collection ban will damage the state's ability to address disparities by race or ethnicity in health care and disease patterns, educational resources and academic achievement, and hate crimes and discrimination.
